properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions near the Richardson Mountains. Easterly winds of 100 km/h gusting to 120 are combining with loose snow to reduce visibility to 400 metres or less. This blizzard is expected to last through the weekend. Winds will ease slightly Sunday night but visibility may still be poor in blowing snow. Blizzard conditions will abate early next week. ### Travel is expected to be very difficult or impossible due to near-zero visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-14T10:33:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-13T18:34:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3224153163.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Less than 1 millimetre of freezing precipitation is expected this morning. Freezing rain will change over to rain near midday. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snow and a few hours of freezing rain are possible today. Total snowfall: 5 cm, except possibly reaching 10 cm over the Highlands. Locations: Victoria County and Inverness County - Mabou and north. Time span: continuing until early this afternoon. Remarks: Snow will spread across Cape Breton this morning and becoming mixed with ice pellets, then to rain mixed with freezing rain later this morning before tapering off this afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-13T23:59:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-13T08:31:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3471283803.2020
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Wind chill values near -55 are expected this morning. Temperatures are expected to moderate somewhat later today and tonight but wind chill values of -55 are possible again Monday afternoon as temperatures are forecast to hover around -40 degree Celsius with winds of 10-20 km/h. ### Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-13T19:59:02-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected beginning Tuesday. Locations: coastal Labrador and the Eagle River area. Time span: Tuesday and Wednesday. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, and strong easterly winds are expected to spread across coastal Labrador on Tuesday. While it is too soon to provide specific details, the potential exists for significant snowfall mid week. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-14T06:37:47-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential winter storm mid week. Locations: Newfoundland. Time span: Tuesday and Wednesday. Maximum wind gusts: westerly 80 km/h with higher gusts likely along coastal areas. Remarks: A storm will track towards Newfoundland Monday night. While it is too soon to provide specific details, the potential exists for strong winds accompanied by significant amounts of snow or rain. Snow and snowsqualls are expected for western and northern Newfoundland, while mainly rain is expected in the east. Central areas may see a change from snow to rain throughout this event. Additional information will be provided as the details become more certain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-14T11:20:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-13T19:21:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0878388329.2020

properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Warning of potential breaking sea conditions and overwash issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec Region on 2020-12-13. Higher than normal water levels and large waves are expected near the coast on December 13th 2020. An intense low pressure system will cause moderate winds in the regions mentioned below. The combination of these winds and the fact that we are currently in a period of high amplitude tidal range could produce minor flooding along the coast near these localities, on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern Standard Time). Kamouraska - Rivière-du-Loup - Trois-Pistoles: 2020-12-13, from 11:00 AM to 03:00 PM. Rimouski - Mont-Joli: 2020-12-13, from 11:00 AM to 03:00 PM. Matane: 2020-12-13, from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM. Sainte-Anne-des-Monts - Grande-Vallée: 2020-12-13, from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM. Forillon Park - Gaspé - Percé: 2020-12-13, from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM. New-Carlisle - Chandler: 2020-12-13, from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM. Les Escoumins - Forestville: 2020-12-13, from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM. Baie-Comeau: 2020-12-13, from 10:30 AM to 02:30 PM. Sept-Îles - Port-Cartier: 2020-12-13, from 10:00 AM to 02:00 PM. ### Coastal erosion is possible in vulnerable areas. Storm surge warnings are issued when water levels pose a threat to coastal regions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-13T21:59:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-13T15:56:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0901285735.2020
Area: Forestville area, Les Escoumins area, Mont-Joli area, Le Bic - Rimouski area, Matane, Grande-Vallée area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area, Chandler area, New Carlisle - Port-Daniel area, Forillon National Park - Gaspé area, Percé area, Baie-Comeau, Baie-Trinité area, Sept-Îles - Port-Cartier area, Trois-Pistoles area, Kamouraska area, Rivière-du-Loup area
